alert.note: Alert for Clay; Early (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 12 at 5:52PM EDT until May 12 at 8:15PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Clay County in southwestern Georgia... Northwestern Early County in southwestern Georgia... * Until 815 PM EDT. * At 552 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 3 and 4 inches of rain have fallen in the last 1 Hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Bluffton and Ferrell Crossroads. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
